definitions.text: mail that is distributed by a rapid and efficient system
public transport consisting of a fast train or bus that makes only a few scheduled stops
examples: he caught the express to New York

definitions.text: articulate; either verbally or with a cry, shout, or noise
serve as a means for expressing something
examples: The painting of Mary carries motherly love
His voice carried a lot of anger

definitions.text: indicate through a symbol, formula, etc.
examples: Can you express this distance in kilometers?

definitions.text: manifest the effects of (a gene or genetic trait)
examples: Many of the laboratory animals express the trait

definitions.text: obtain from a substance, as by mechanical action
examples: Italians express coffee rather than filter it

definitions.text: send by rapid transport or special messenger service
examples: She expressed the letter to Florida
